title: Remove Menu page from navigation and make Order the default home page

requirements.text: Change the default route so that navigating to '/' redirects to '/order' instead of '/menu'.

quotes: remove the menu from the 1st page and make order the 1st page

acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app at the root URL '/' takes the user directly to the Order page.
No redirect to '/menu' occurs on initial load.

requirements.text: Remove the 'Menu' tab/link from the bottom navigation bar (Navigation.tsx) so only 'Order' and 'Reports' tabs are visible.

quotes: remove the menu from the 1st page

acceptanceCriteria: The bottom navigation bar no longer shows a 'Menu' tab.
Only 'Order' and 'Reports' tabs are present in the navigation.
The active tab highlighting still works correctly for the remaining tabs.

requirements.text: Keep the Menu Management page ('/menu') accessible to admin users via a route, but do not expose it in the main navigation. Admin users may access it through the app header or another admin-only entry point if one exists.

quotes: remove the menu from the 1st page

acceptanceCriteria: The '/menu' route still renders the MenuManagement page for admin users.
Non-admin users cannot reach the menu management page through the navigation UI.
Admin users have at least one way to navigate to Menu Management (e.g., a link in the header when isAdmin is true).

constraints: Do not modify any file under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui/ (immutable paths).
Do not change any backend logic or data models.
nonGoals: Redesigning the Order page layout or adding new order features.
Removing the Menu Management page entirely from the codebase.
